name: WifiSecureAccess
0:
”Alexa, turn on name”
”Alexa, turn off name,”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
This skill is developed to operate our configurable smart IOT devices using Amazon alexa. The device is a general-purpose one and a variety of appliances can be connected to it. It can control Garage doors, locks, Doors, Parking Gate. This is in addition to Switches, Sockets and lights and any other OnOff type of appliances.

With wifisecureaccess skill, customers can operate these types of appliances connect5ed to out IOT devices.

More details on these IOT devices are available at: 

https://wifisecureaccess.com.

Detailed documentation on installing these devices and configuring them is available at: 

https://wifisecureaccess.com/docs_page/

Details on enabling wifisecureaccess skill in Alexa and using them is available in the subsection of that document labelled: "2.11 Using Amazon alexa to activate a port of your device"

When this device is cabled to an existing automatic garage door, for example, customers can enable this skill. Then, the customers can say "Alexa, Turn On garage <garage door>", or "alexa, Turn Off <Garage Door>".

Another example, when the device is connected to a lock on the door, with this skill enabled, customers can say "Alexa, Lock <my lock> " or "Alexa, unlock <my lock>".

Mostly all the OnOff type of devices can be controlled by these devices and with alexa, then can put them On/Off by saying, "Alexa, Turn On <device name>" or "Alexa, turn off <device name>".

As mentioned above, refer to the full documentation of the device. Also refer to the subsection on alexa to enable the devices to be discovered by Alexa.
